com.parse4cn1.command

Class ParseResponse

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.parse4cn1.command.ParseResponse

  • public class ParseResponse
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encapsulates a response to a ParseCommand issued to the Parse server.

        public boolean isFailed()
        If true, the associated ParseCommand failed.
        Returns:

      • getException

        public ParseException getException()
        Returns:
        An exception that encapsulates the failure associated with this ParseResponse.

      • getParseError

        public static ParseException getParseError(ca.weblite.codename1.json.JSONObject response)
        Converts the provided raw response into the corresponding ParseException.
        Parameters:
        response - The response received from the Parse server.
        Returns:
        The exception corresponding to response.

      • getResponseData

        public byte[] getResponseData()
        Returns:
        The raw response data received from the Parse server.

      • getJsonObject

        public ca.weblite.codename1.json.JSONObject getJsonObject()
                                                   throws ParseException
        Returns:
        The response received from the Parse server encoded in a JSONObject.
        Throws:
        ParseException - if anything goes wrong with converting the response to JSON.

      • extractResponseData

        protected void extractResponseData(com.codename1.io.ConnectionRequest request)
        Extracts the response from the provided request.
        Parameters:
        request - The (executed) network request.

      • getStatusCode

        protected int getStatusCode()
        Returns:
        The HTTP status code. This should not be confused with the "code" field returned by the Parse server when a request fails. The latter can be retrieved via the ParseException.getCode() of the exception returned by getException().

      • setConnectionError

        protected void setConnectionError(int statusCode,
                                  java.lang.String message)
        Sets the backend error.
        Parameters:
        statusCode - The HTTP status code.
        message - The HTTP error message.

        protected void setConnectionError(ParseException error)
